metadata.title: CVE-2021-42717 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
ModSecurity 3.x through 3.0.5 mishandles excessively nested JSON objects.Crafted JSON objects with nesting tens-of-thousands deep could result inthe web server being unable to service legitimate requests. Even amoderately large (e.g., 300KB) HTTP request can occupy one of the limitedNGINX worker processes for minutes and consume almost all of the availableCPU on the machine. Modsecurity 2 is similarly vulnerable: the affectedversions include 2.8.0 through 2.9.4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-42717` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-security2 - 2.9.7-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: modsecurity package in oracular is affected and may need fixing.
modsecurity-apache package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7-1').
